intro: Torilis intermedia, commonly known as field eryngo, is an annual herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring a slender stem covered in fine hairs. The plant has opposite, lance-shaped leaves that are often hairy and have a slightly aromatic scent. Its small, yellow flowers are arranged in a spherical inflorescence, blooming from June to August. Torilis intermedia is often found in disturbed soils, such as roadsides and waste areas, and is known for its medicinal properties in traditional herbal remedies.
